intro: Telanthera filifolia, commonly known as the threadleaf telanthera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, thread-like leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Telanthera filifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
